p: The dosage of condensed tannins was performed using sulfuric vanillin as a reagent, by a method described elsewhere [ 18]. Aliquots of 1 mL of OFIEOH at 5 mg/mL concentration in distilled water were mixed with 2 mL of 2% ( v/ v) sulfuric vanillin solution. The mixture was kept in a water bath at 20 °C for 5 min. Aliquots of 200 μL were transferred to a 96-well microplate and the absorbance was measured at 500 nm. Commercial epicatechin (Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA) was used for the standard curve, and the concentrations ranged from 1.25 to 30 μg/mL (R 2 = 0.9996). All samples were tested in triplicate.
